channel.title: Engadget
channel.description: Engadget is a web magazine with obsessive daily coverage of everything new in gadgets and consumer electronics
channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2021 Yahoo! Inc. All rights reserved

item.title: NASA wants to use its Mars helicopter to support Perseverance rover
item.description: After making history and completing two additional flights, NASA's Ingenuity Mars Helicopter could soon attempt even more ambitious forays into the skies of the Red Planet.

item.title: Apple's new 11-inch iPad Pro is already $50 off at Walmart
item.description: Walmart knocks $50 off Apple's new 2021 11-inch iPad Pro, bringing it down to $749.

item.title: Riot will record voice chats in 'Valorant' to tackle harassment
item.description: The publisher said it will only listen to a recording after a report is filed.

item.title: Hulu expands its live TV service with ViacomCBS networks
item.description: Comedy Central, BET, MTV and more are available to watch today.

item.title: 'Fall Guys' is delayed indefinitely on Switch and Xbox
item.description: You'll have to wait until after the summer to play on those consoles, but cross-play is on the way.

item.title: TikTok’s new CEO is an executive from its parent company
item.description: TikTok announced today Shouzi Chew, the current chief financial officer of parent company ByteDance, will take over leading the firm.

item.title: The EU's proposed AI laws would regulate robot surgeons but not the military
item.description: The European Commission has unveiled a sweeping regulatory framework that, if adopted, could have global implications for the future of AI development.

item.title: This week's best deals: 40 percent off Amazon's Echo Dot and more
item.description: This week's best tech deals include $20 off Amazon's Echo Dot, up to $200 off Samsung's Galaxy S21 smartphones, and $40 off Star Wars Instant Pots.

item.title: Teenage Engineering's Capcom videopaks blend your music with classic games
item.description: Music makers with the OP-Z synth can use the new Capcom videopaks to add retro gaming scenes to their music.

item.title: Rhythm shooter 'BPM: Bullets Per Minute' heads to Xbox and PlayStation this year
item.description: Stylish rhythm shooter BPM: Bullets Per Minute is heading to PlayStation 4 and Xbox One later this year.

item.title: Get three years of PlayStation Plus for over 50 percent off
item.description: Score three years of PlayStation Plus at a significant discount. With PS Plus, you’ll get access to multiplayer games, cloud storage and new free titles each month.

item.title: Samsung Galaxy A52 5G: Can just ‘good’ be good enough?
item.description: We get pretty worked up when a new, premium smartphone shows up. And I’d be lying if I said playing with expensive hardware wasn’t one of the best parts of this job. It’s especially nice because, more often than not, the last thing I want to do is pay for some of the things we test. Which brings me to an important question: how much should anyone actually shell out for a new smartphone? The short answer is “as much as you’re comfortable with.” Thankfully, companies are working to make their more affordable devices flashier than ever. Case in point: I’ve spent a few days with Samsung’s new A52 5G, and while it might not satisfy those with flagship tastes, it gets pretty close sometimes.

item.title: Roku pulls YouTube TV from its store as Google feud deepens
item.description: Existing users can still access the app on their Roku device.

item.title: 'Returnal' captures the beauty (and frustration) of failure
item.description: Returnal is an excellent PS5 shooter, but it's also unforgivingly difficult.

item.title: How Hainbach tackled 'the Dark Souls of synthesis'
item.description: The composer and YouTuber on his test equipment-based album and virtual instrument 'Landfill Totems.'

item.title: Google's new Play Store rules target misleading app listings
item.description: Google is enforcing new Play store policies designed to crack down on misleading and inaccurate app store listings.

item.title: The best tech gifts for new moms
item.description: Here's a list of the best tech gadgets for new moms, as chosen by Engadget editors.

item.title: Engadget Podcast: Samsung's slew of Galaxy Book laptops
item.description: This week, Cherlynn and Devindra chat Samsung’s latest Galaxy Unpacked fiesta and all its new laptops.

item.title: YouTube is testing SoundCloud-like timestamped comments
item.description: YouTube has started testing a new feature that gives you a quick way to view comments "timed to the exact moment you're watching in a video."

item.title: The Morning After: New WiFi 6E routers are starting to go on sale
item.description: New WiFi 6E routers are going on sale, with prices that start at $500 and go up from there.

item.title: Star Wars Instant Pots hit all-time low prices ahead of May the 4th
item.description: Williams Sonoma's Star Wars-branded Instant Pots have gone on sale on Amazon at some of the steepest discounts we've seen.

item.title: The EU's Apple antitrust investigation is moving forward
item.description: The EU has opened a formal probe into how Apple runs the App Store.

item.title: London City is the first major airport to control air traffic via a digital tower
item.description: London City Airport has become the first major international airport to launch a remote air traffic control system.

item.title: Watch the trailer for the final season of Netflix's 'Castlevania'
item.description: Netflix has released a two-and-a-half minute trailer to give you a glimpse of what you can expect from the final season of Castlevania.

item.title: Stratolaunch completes second flight of world's largest plane
item.description: Stratolaunch hascompleted the second test flight of its carrier vehicle, which is currently known for being the world's largest aircraft by wingspan.
